meanings.definition: To attract or charm by insincere flattery or excessive sweetness.
meanings.sent1: She tried to win him over by coying up to him with compliments.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson was coying the customer to make a sale.
meanings.sent3: The cat was coying the mouse with promises of friendship.
meanings.sent4: The politician coying the voters with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The child coying the teacher for a better grade.

meanings.definition: Excessively sweet or sentimental in a way that is considered insincere or artificial.
meanings.sent1: Her coying smile made him suspicious of her intentions.
meanings.sent2: The coying music in the movie made her cringe.
meanings.sent3: The coying decorations at the party were over the top.
meanings.sent4: The coying message in the card felt insincere.
meanings.sent5: The coying scent of the flowers filled the room.
